intro: Corydalis zetterlundii, commonly known as the Sierra foothill corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fumariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Corydalis zetterlundii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
